description:
Argentina announces new measures for universities and higher education institutions. Through resolution 104/2020 signed by the Minister of Education, Nicolás Trotta, institutions are asked to reduce the number of students in the courses and implement the use of virtual teaching. 
All scientific or academic activities such as events, congresses, seminars, courses, symposia, workshops, samples or exhibitions, insofar as they involve crowds or concentrations of people, must be rescheduled. MAR. 14 2020

description:
Argentina, the Province of San Juan opens of for face-to-face schools in 14 regions. The students of the last year of primary, secondary, technical and agrotechnical education will return to classes, but there will be no more than 15 students per classroom. 

These children will be the first to return to school in Argentina with a “bimodal” system, “bubble” classrooms and a sanitary kit supplied for each student, with time with teachers complementing and enhancing homework and remote lessons online.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description:
Argentina, Health Ministry authorises emergency approval of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine. 

The first shipment, of the total 25 million doses of the vaccine, bought by the Argentine government is due to arrive in the last week of December.

Argentina started vaccinations on December 29, 2020. Health personnel are the first in line to receive the vaccine. The largest vaccination campaign in the history of Argentina takes place simultaneously throughout the country.
type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping; storage; administration) of COVID-19 vaccines

description: Argentina receives the second doses of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine arrived at the Ezeiza International Airport the weekend 15-17 January.  The second batch consisted of 300 000 doses.
type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping; storage; administration) of COVID-19 vaccines

description: Argentina investigates situation in border crossings control in Iguazú, Misiones, which borders with Paraguay and Brazil and is witness to the entry of 11 million people per year. The President, Alberto Fernández, entrusted the Ministers of the Interior, Wado de Pedro, and of Security, Sabina Frederic, to verify the situation at the main border crossings of the country. The main aim is to strengthen the controls, monitor, be close to the needs of the people, as well as verify that the WHO protocols are met. MAR. 13 2020
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Argentina closes its borders to non-residents for 15 days. In order to allow the normal supply of essential supplies, persons affected from international trade operations for the transportation of loads of merchandise, as well as flights and transfers for medical purposes are exempted, notwithstanding that, in all
cases, it is verified that they are asymptomatic and comply with the recommendations established by the Ministry of Health. MAR. 16 2020

description:
Argentina. The National Directorate of Migration establishes the "Electronic Sworn Declaration for entering and leaving the National Territory" , available on their website. 

The measure will speed up the migration process as well as the treatment of the information given to the health authorities in pursuit of the care of the population as a whole. Come into effect as of Sept 7, 2020.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Argentina is opening borders for tourists from neighbouring counties from October 30. 

The Ministry of the Interior reported that foreigners who enter the country may do so through the Ezeiza International Airport or through the Buquebús maritime terminal, in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires and must present at the time of the immigration process: an Electronic Affidavit, a PCR test with a negative result and a COVID medical insurance.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentina, The National Government decided to suspend the entry and exit of flights to and from Great Britain as of December 21, 2020. It is preventively, and as a result of the epidemiological situation in that country, after declaring the appearance of a new strain of COVID-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentinian Minister of Labour, Employment and Social Security, Claudio Moroni, signed resolutions 178 and 184/2020 establishing an exceptional license for workers, both in the public and private sector, allowing them to return to Argentina after having visited countries with an outbreak of the Coronavirus virus (China, South Korea, Japan, Iran, Italy, Spain, France and Germany). They are to return to Argentina and comply with the health precautions established in the recommendations of the National Ministry of Health. MAR. 06 2020
type_text: "Exceptional license" issued for Argentinian workers who are currently in affected countries for work reasons to come back to Argentina without their work remuneration being affected.

description: Mandatory use of the COVID 19- Ministry of Health app for everyone entering Argentina. They have to use it for a minimum of 14 days from their entry. It must be used within 12 hours from said entry. MAR 25

Argentina incorporates COVID-19 into the compulsory notification disease regime in order to generate updated information for the adoption of timely, transparent and evidence-based measures available to mitigate the spread of the new coronavirus within the territory. The Ministry of Health provides for the incorporation of COVID-19 among the notifiable diseases and establishes that clinical and laboratory surveillance strategies, determined by the National Health Surveillance System in its computer platform. MAR. 30 2020

description: Argentina's National Government implements measure to build Modular Emergency Hospitals. The measure will allow the construction of 8 Modular Emergency Hospitals according to the current map of the pandemic, and therefore Argentina will count with an expansion of 560 hospital beds, 24-hour care by a staff of 100 health workers. Also, two hospitals in La Matanza will be completed. MAR. 18 2020

description: Argentina's Ministry of Transport creates a Crisis Committee and establishes prevention measures for coronavirus. The “Covid-19 Prevention Crisis Committee” includes a commission for rail transport, another for automotive, and a third for river, maritime and lake transport. Duties include early consultation for symptomatic citizens, coordination with local private or public institutions for assistance, and management of COVID-19 cases. The Ministry also dictates the increase of hygiene in transport systems. MAR. 13 2020

On May 10th, it was announced that the lockdown was extended again until May 24.

description: City of Córdoba in Argentina resumes lockdown after virus cases spike.

Argentina continues the lockdown started the March 20, in a new form. Social, preventive and mandatory isolation will be extended until June 7. 

Because the epidemiological situation is not homogenous within the national territory, the administration of isolation will adopt a modality that contemplates the reality of the country's various jurisdictions. MAY 24

Further extended until July 17 2020. UPDATE: Further extended until July 17 2020.

Argentina continues the lockdown started the March 20, in a new form. Social, preventive and mandatory isolation will be extended until June 7. Because the epidemiological situation is not homogenous within the national territory, the administration of isolation will adopt a modality that contemplates the reality of the country's various jurisdictions. MAY 24 UPDATE: Extended until August 2. 

Reason: During the course of these more than 117 days from the beginning of the implemented prevention policies, the capacity of the health system has been improved and strengthened, the acquisition of supplies and equipment, registering a decrease in the speed of spread in a large part of the country, having avoided, to date, the saturation of the health system. In this context, and given the observation that different realities that must be approached differently, in epidemiological matters, continue to coexist in our country.

Argentina continues the lockdown started the March 20, in a new form. Social, preventive and mandatory isolation will be extended until June 7. Because the epidemiological situation is not homogenous within the national territory, the administration of isolation will adopt a modality that contemplates the reality of the country's various jurisdictions. MAY 24

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory isolation from June 8 - June 28 in Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area.


Prohibited activities during the validity of social, preventive and compulsory isolation: 

1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.

2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.

3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.

4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.

5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory isolation from June 8 - June 28 in The Department of San Fernando of the Province of Chaco..
   
   
Prohibited activities during the validity of social, preventive and compulsory isolation: 
   
   1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.
   
   2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.
   
   3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.
   
   4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.
   
   5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares.

description:
Argentina continues the lockdown started the March 20, in a new form. Social, preventive and mandatory isolation was extended until June 7, now extended until June 28. 

Considering that the transmission dynamics of the new coronavirus has evidenced different realities in epidemiological matters within our country, the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that fo not present community transmission of the virus. In those territories where this type of circulation persists, the ASPO will continue in force until June 28 inclusive. JUNE 7 UPDATE: The extension was set until June 7. Now extended until June 28 2020.

   1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.
   
   2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.
   
   3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.
   
   4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.
   
   5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares. UPDATE: The original isolation policy is for the Department of San Fernando of the Province Chaco. Between July 1 until July 17 the whole Province of Chaco was a part of the social, preventive and compulsory isolation measures. 

Now, from July 18 until August 2, the Department of San Fernando is under the isolation measures, while the rest of the Province of Chaco is under social distancing measures.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from August 2 - August 16. 
    
The Department of Guer Aike of the Province of La Pampa. 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: 
Extended until August 30.

The department of Caucete of the Province of San Juan, between August 30 until September 20. 
    
Prohibited activities during the validity of social, preventive and compulsory isolation: 
    
    1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.
    
    2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.
    
    3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.
    
    4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.
    
    5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory isolation. 

The agglomerates of the cities of Paraná, Colonia Avellaneda, Oro Verde, San Benito and Gualeguaychú of the Province of Entre Ríos, between August 30 until September 20. 
    
Prohibited activities during the validity of social, preventive and compulsory isolation: 
    
    1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.
    
    2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.
    
    3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.
    
    4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.
    
    5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory isolation from June 8 - June 28 in the Departments of Bariloche and General Roca of the Province of Río Negro. From August 30 until September 20 it concerns the the agglomerations of the cities of Bariloche and Dina Huapi and the department of General Roca of the Province of Río Negro.
    
Prohibited activities during the validity of social, preventive and compulsory isolation: 
    
    1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.
    
    2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.
    
    3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.
    
    4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.
    
    5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares. UPDATE: The original policy was from June 8 until June 28. It was extended until July 17, and and concerning the Department of General Roca in the Province of Río Negro. Between July 17 and August 30 it was in the category of social distancing. From August 30 until September 20 it concerns The agglomerations of the cities of Bariloche and Dina Huapi and the department of General Roca of the Province of Rio Negro.
city: Departments of Bariloche and General Roca
target_city: Departments of Bariloche and General Roca

description:
Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory isolation between Oct 11 until Oct 25, in the departments of Biedma and Escalante in the Province of Chubut. 
    
Prohibited activities during the validity of social, preventive and compulsory isolation: 
    
    1. Dictation of face-to-face classes at all levels and all modalities.
    
    2. Public and private events: social, cultural, recreational, sporting, religious and of any other nature that involve the attendance of people.
    
    3. Shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people.
    
    4. Public Interurban, interjurisdictional and international passenger transport service, except for the cases provided in article 19 of this decree.
    
    5. Tourism. Opening of parks and squares.
 UPDATE: The policy now concerns social isolation for the the departments of Biedma and Escalante in the Province of Chubut, between Oct 11 until Oct 25.
Argentina. The extension of the Health Emergency for a period of one year, empowering the Ministry of Health as the enforcement authority. MAR 11
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Argentina's Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation formed the Coronavirus COVID-19 Unit. Its objective is to coordinate the capabilities of the scientific and technological systems that may be required to perform diagnostic and research tasks on Coronavirus COVID-19. MAR. 18 2020
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Argentina has created "Programs Universidades por la Emergencia del Covid-19" (PULPLEC19). 

Joint resolution between the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Education to promote the active collaboration of university institutions in community actions related to health care, prevention and promotion, in coordinations with the different public health stakeholders, as well as assistance and accompaniment work for people belonging to risk groups.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: Cooperation among different jurisdictional entities (e.g. treaties or agreements among countries or provinces)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina implements social protection plan to ensure alimentation and health for all. This means that the prices of basic food basket, drinks, toiletries and cleaning will maintain the price they had as of March 6. This applies to hypermarkets, retail and wholesale supermarkets, mini-markets, warehouses and self-services. MAR. 20 2020
type_text: This is an economic policy to control the price of basic food basket, drinks, toiletries and cleaning products.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Argentina's government will implement the Family Income Emergency (IFE) to alleviate the situation of workers most affected by the emergency. MAR. 23 2020

Argentina, The Ministry of Territorial Development and Habitat created the  "Federal Argentina Build Solidarity Program". 

The initiative proposes financing the purchase of materials and equipment for the execution of minor works that allow an improvement in the conditions of the spaces that provide services to the community.
type_text: New program to help different neighbourhoods in Argentina
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina's Ministry of the Interior carries out a personalised awareness and prevention campaign to Argentines who were recently abroad, who receive recommendations and information on the measures taken by the national government for the Covid-19 pandemic, including the mandatory compliance with the quarantine period via text message. The message states that "Upon your return to the country from affected areas, respect the legal quarantine of 14 days. It is mandatory and failure to comply with it is a crime". MAR. 17 2020

Argentina enables a video call service for people with hearing disabilities in order to provide adequate, reliable and accessible information on risk factors and preventive measures related to COVID-19. The National Disability Agency offers a video call service (115728-4011) that will answer queries from Monday to Friday from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. MAR. 19 2020
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina introduces mandatory use of the COVID-19 application for everyone entering the country for a minimum of 14 days to make the implementation of measures against COVID-19 more efficient. MAR. 25 2020
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Argentina declares that people who are in any of the situations detailed in article N° 7 of Decree N° 260/2020 (e.g. having contracted the virus, arrived from highly affected countries, presents symptoms...), should not go to their workplaces for 14 days and their wages should be maintained.

The measure covers all workers, regardless of their employment relationship or form of contract, dependent or non-dependent, scholarships in workplaces, internships, medical residences or any other modality, occasional or permanent, for those who have multiple employment with the measure. Measure reaches all workplaces. 
MAR. 14 2020 UPDATE: Resolutions 178 and 184/2020 are revoked and workers should not go to their workplaces for 14 days and their wages should be maintained.
type_text: "Exceptional license" issued for Argentinian workers who are currently in affected countries for work reasons to come back to Argentina without their work remuneration being affected.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Argentina implements partial lockdown. Until 31st of March included, travels are restricted excepted for valid reasons and population is forced to quarantine. Limited quarantine exemptions include movement to obtain food and medical care and travel to the international airport for ticketed passengers only. Enforced by the police. MAR. 19 2020
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentina implements partial lockdown. Until 31st of March included, travels are restricted excepted for valid reasons and population is forced to quarantine. Limited quarantine exemptions include movement to obtain food and medical care and travel to the international airport for ticketed passengers only. Enforced by the police. MAR. 19 2020. From MAY 10,  the compulsory isolation and social distancing will continue. However, local authorities can now allow activities and exceptions to circulation will now occur on the local level. Until MAY 24 UPDATE: Argentinas preventive and compulsory social isolation and social distancing decreased the spread of the virus. The compulsory isolation and social distancing will continue. However, local authorities can now allow activities and exceptions to circulation will now occur on the local level. Until MAY 24
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentina enacted a mandatory quarantine beginning on March 20 at 12:01am.  The quarantine has been extended through April 12. UPDATE: The original quarantine was set to last until March 31, it has been extended to April 12.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentina's President Alberto Fernandez has decided to extend Argentina's quarantine and lockdown until 23 April, 2020. He claims it will not be more flexible than before. APR. 07 2020 UPDATE: The quarantine has again been extended from April 12 to April 23 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentina implements partial lockdown. Until 31st of March included, travels are restricted excepted for valid reasons and population is forced to quarantine. Limited quarantine exemptions include movement to obtain food and medical care and travel to the international airport for ticketed passengers only. Enforced by the police. MAR. 19 2020. It has now been extended again, until JUN 7, 2020. UPDATE: Argentina enforced a partial lockdown MAR 19. It has been extended several times, and is now extended again (May 25) until JUNE 7.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Argentina closes "cultural spaces". The Ministry of Culture informs that in view of the health situation due to the cases and transmission of COVID-19 in the country, all public activities have been ordered to be closed in the National Museums as well as in the Cervantes National Theatre and the Kirchner Cultural Centre. MAR. 12 2020
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is closed/locked down

MAR. 12 2020 This has been extended until June 28 and concerns: shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, cultural centers, libraries, museums, restaurants, bars, gyms, clubs and any public or private space that involves the attendance of people. UPDATE: The original closing of cultural spaces has now been extended until June 28.

description: Argentina: from March 20 to August 30, food, beverage, personal hygiene and cleaning companies are required to keep their prices frozen at their March 6 values. No matter where you buy, the prices of these products cannot increase.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Argentina, the government has banned the sale of tickets for all commercial flights to and from Argentina until September 1 2020. Only flights carrying cargo and those involved in the repatriation of citizens will be allowed to operate.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: In Argentina, the football season is officially over after it was interrupted in mid-march due to the virus crisis. APR 24.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is closed/locked down
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentinas Iguazú Falls reopens to local residens after 100-day Covid-19 closure. For now, 200 visitors a day, divided into four groups of 50 individuals, will be able to enter the Iguazú National Park. Only residents of Puerto Iguazú will be allowed to apply for tickets. JULY 12
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Argentina freezes the prices for telephones, internet and paid television to secure access to information for all in Argentina. This applies from the 31 of July until December 31 2020.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Telecommunications") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Argentina freezes the prices for telephones, internet and paid television to secure access to information for all in Argentina. This applies from the 31 of July until December 31 2020.

description: Argentina is establishing new provision for public passenger transport. The public services of automotive transport of urban and suburban passengers of national jurisdiction must circulate with a number of passengers that does not exceed the capacity of available seats. Exceptionally, in the hours of greatest service requirement and in the face of excess demand, the capacity may be expanded up to 10 standing passengers, in compliance with with the recommendations on social distancing.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina bans mass gatherings in the context of sporting events nationwide. MAR. 12 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina's National Parks Administration (APN) ordered, this Sunday, the closure and suspension of activities in all parks with public use areas that are under its jurisdiction, within the framework of the measures adopted throughout the country to mitigate the spread of the coronavirus. MAR. 15 2020
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina limits public gatherings by forbidding standing room passengers in public transports. MAR. 19 2020.

Argentina's Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Health, provides to reinforce preventive measures, urging educational establishments to justify absences for those who present symptoms compatible with COVID-19. MAR. 06 2020
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Argentina closes public services and all relevant public services are transferred online. To limit the spread of the virus from the workplace, all agents in the national public sector are authorised not to go to the workplace, allowing them to work from their homes in any of the contracting modalities. This measure excludes workers in the public sector who work in an "essential" service according to authorities from each jurisdiction. This measure is also encouraged in the private sector. MAR. 16 2020
Argentina implements new prevention measures concerning public transport. MAR. 17 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: In Argentina's province of Chubut, Governor Mariano Arcioni ordered the restriction of traffic from 8pm every day, on all the streets, avenues and routes of the province, and ordered that businesses close at 7.30pm "until instructed otherwise". Also, only one person per family may enter commercial premises. A schedule was also established for food businesses: on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, only those people whose documents end in number 0 or even numbers, and Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays who have documents ended in odd numbers, can enter. On Sundays, businesses must remain closed and will be required to carry out a comprehensive disinfection. MAR. 24 2020

Argentina's province of Chubut, a timetable to buy food was established. From 25th March, Banco La Nación will send more than 12,000 food cards destined to all Chubut beneficiaries. This is to increase social distancing measures. MAR. 17 2020

Argentina. In the capital, Buenos Aires, face masks or something that covers the nose and mouth, is obligatory for everyone taking public transit, and for everyone in a position that deals with the public. May be fined if not followed; 10,700 pesos to 79,180 pesos, or risk of having their business closed. APR 16.
enforcer: Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. 

This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. 
- Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description:
Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. 
   

This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people.  - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
 - Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres.

This is prohibited in the covered provinces:

- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. 
    
Province: Santa Fe 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres

Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. 
    
Province: Río Negro, except those of Bariloche and General Roca.
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from July 8 - July 28. Now extended until July 17. 

This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. 
- Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. 

 UPDATE: It has been extended until July 17.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until July 17. 
    
Province: Santa Fe 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: Extended until July 17.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside private businesses (e.g. supermarkets)

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until Aug 2. 
    
Province: Chubut
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: Extended until Aug 2.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until Aug 2. 
   
Province: La Rioja
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. 
 UPDATE: Extended until Aug 2.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until August 2. 
    
 Province: Salta
    
 This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
 - Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
 - Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: Extended until August 2.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until August 2. 
    
Province: Santiago del Estero 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: Extended until August 2.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. 

Province: Jujuy
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: This was original a social distancing measure but has from July 18 been changed to social isolation measures. These changes will last until August 2. 

Due to this there will be coded a new policy concerning social isolation in the Province of Jujuy.

- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: This was original a social distancing measure but has from July 18 been changed to social isolation measures. These changes will last until August 2. 

Due to this there will be coded a new policy concerning social isolation in the Province of Jujuy.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until August 16. 
    
Province: Santa Fe 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: Extended until August 16.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until August 30. 
    
Province: Córdoba. 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: Extended until August 30. The original was set to the Province of Cordoba, except the city of Cordoba. Now it concerns the whole Province of Cordoba, including the city of Cordoba.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until August 30. 
 
Province: La Pampa
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: The original policy was for the whole Province of La Pampa. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until August 30. 
    
Province: Santa Fe 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: Extended until August 30.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on ridership of subways and trams

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 11. 

Province; Corrientes. 
   
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. 
- Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: Extended until October 11.

description:
Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 11. 

Province; Entre Rios. 

This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people.  - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
 - Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: The original was for the whole Province of Entre Rios. From August 31 until September 20 it concerns the Province of Entre Rios, except the agglomerates of the cities of Paraná, Colonia Avellaneda, Oro Verde, San Benito and Gualeguaychú. From September 20 until October 11, it concerns the whole Province of Entre Rios again.

Province: Jujuy, except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro. 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: 
The original policy was for the Province of Jujuy. It was ended between July 18  until August 2. Between August 3 until August 17 the Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen and San Pedro, was again concerned the distancing measures. This has now again been extended until September 20. From September 20 until October 11, the measures concerns all the departments of Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro.

Province: Jujuy, except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro. 
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: 
The original policy was for the Province of Jujuy. It was ended between July 18  until August 2. Between August 3 until August 17 the Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen and San Pedro, was again concerned the distancing measures. This has now again been extended until September 20. From September 20 until October 11, the measures concerns all the departments of Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 25. 

Province: Entre Rios.    

This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people.  - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
 - Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: The original was for the whole Province of Entre Rios. From August 31 until September 20 it concerns the Province of Entre Rios, except the agglomerates of the cities of Paraná, Colonia Avellaneda, Oro Verde, San Benito and Gualeguaychú. From September 20 until October 11, it concerns the whole Province of Entre Rios again. This is extended until October 25.

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 25. 

Province: Formosa. 
   
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: Extended until October 25.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 25. 
 
Province: La Pampa
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: The original policy was for the whole Province of La Pampa. Between August 2 until August 16, its for the Province of La Pampa,  except those of Atreucó, Catriló, Capital and Toay. From August 17, it is back to concern the whole Province of La Pampa. Extended until September 20 and again until October 11. Now it is extended again until October 25.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

This is prohibited in the covered provinces:

In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 25. 

Province: Jujuy, except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: The original policy was for the Province of Jujuy. It was ended between July 18  until August 2. Between August 3 until August 17 the Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen and San Pedro, was again concerned the distancing measures. This has now again been extended until September 20. From September 20 until October 11, the measures concerns all the departments of Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro. From October 11 until October 25, it concerns all the departments of Province of Jujuy except the departments of Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Yavi, Susques, Rinconada and San Pedro.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 25. 
    
 Province: Salta, except those of Cerrillos, Rosario de Lerma, General Güemes, La Caldera and Capital. 
    
 This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
 - Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
 - Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres. UPDATE: The original policy was concerning the Province of Salta. From August 17 until August 30, it concerns the Province of Salta, except General José de San Martin. From August 31 until September 20, it concerns the Province of Salta, except those of General José de San Martin and Orán. From September 20 until October 11, it concerns the Province of Salta, except those of General José de San Martín, Cerrillos, Rosario de Lerma, General Güemes, La Caldera, Orán and Capital. From October 11 until October 25, it concerns the Province of Salta, except those of Cerrillos, Rosario de Lerma, General Güemes, La Caldera and Capital.

From September 20 until October 11, it concerns Province Santa Cruz except the agglomerate of the City of Río Gallegos. Between Oct 11 and Oct 25, it concerns the Province of Santa Cruz, except the agglomerates of the City of Río Gallegos, El Calafate and Caleta Olivia.

Argentina. Social, preventive and compulsory distancing - the National Government has decided to establish a new regulatory framework for those areas that do not present community transmission of the virus. In the areas where the circulation of the virus persist, social, preventive and compulsory distancing will continue from June 8 - June 28. Extended until October 25. 
    
Province: Santa Fe, except the departments of Rosario, La Capital, General López, Caseros, Constitución, San Lorenzo, Las Colonias and Castellanos.
    
This is prohibited in the covered provinces: 
- Holding events in public or private spaces, social, cultural, recreational, religious and of any other nature with attendance of more than 10 people. - Practice of any sports where more than 10 people participate or that does not allow maintaining the minimum distance of 2 meters between participants. 
- Cinemas, theatres, clubs and cultural centres UPDATE: The original policy was for the whole Province of Santa Fe. From Oct 11 until Oct 25, it concerns the whole Province of Santa Fe, except except the departments of Rosario, La Capital, General López, Caseros, Constitución, San Lorenzo, Las Colonias and Castellanos.
